subject: resource/Uninvited_(video_game)
object: Uninvited is a haunted house "point-and-click" adventure game developed originally for the Apple Macintosh  by ICOM Simulations released in 1986 by Mindscape.The game uses the MacVenture engine that was introduced in ICOM's prior game, Deja Vu: a Nightmare Comes True. It is the only MacVenture that takes place in the present day.A number of ports were made. Two years later, a full rewrite for Windows was released.
human_readable: The comment about Uninvited is that it is a haunted house 'point-and-click' adventure game developed originally for the Apple Macintosh by ICOM Simulations, released in 1986 by Mindscape, using the MacVenture engine introduced in Deja Vu: a Nightmare Comes True, and it's the only MacVenture that takes place in the present day; additionally, a number of ports were made and two years later, a full rewrite for Windows was released.

It also mentions that it uses the MacVenture engine introduced in Deja Vu: a Nightmare Comes True, and that it is the only MacVenture to take place in the present day. This information supports the comment provided about Uninvited being a haunted house "point-and-click" adventure game developed originally for the Apple Macintosh by ICOM Simulations, released in 1986 by Mindscape, using the MacVenture engine introduced in Deja Vu: a Nightmare Comes True, and it's the only MacVenture that takes place in the present day; additionally, a number of ports were made and two years later, a full rewrite for Windows was released.
